decision_conditions:
Condition : 1 - The development hereby permitted shall be begun within 3 years from the date of the original permission ref. 2012/1258 (dated 18/10/2012). 
Reason: To prevent the accumulation of unimplemented planning permissions and to comply with Section 91 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended) and to meet the requirements of Section 51 of the Planning and Compulsory Purchase Act 2004 and to meet the requirements of The Town and Country Planning (Development Management Procedure) (England) Order 2015.
Condition : 2 - For each phase of the development details of those parts of the site not covered by buildings, including any parking areas, access ways, surface treatment and boundary treatment, shall be submitted to and approved by the local planning authority prior to the commencement of relevant works within that phase.  Phase 1 shall be undertaken in accordance with the details approved by reference 2013/2434. Phase 2 shall be undertaken in accordance with the details approved by reference 2019/4728.
To ensure a high quality of development in compliance with Council policy DMS1
Condition : 3 - For each phase of the development details of proposed boundary treatment shall be submitted to and approved by the local planning authority. Such details as may be approved shall be carried out prior to occupation of each relevant phase of the development.  Phase 1 shall be undertaken in accordance with the details approved by reference 2013/2434. Phase 2 shall be undertaken in accordance with the details approved by reference 2020/2631
To ensure a satisfactory appearance and to accord with Council policy DMS1

Condition : 4 - Notwithstanding any materials specified in the application, details and samples of materials proposed to be used on all external surfaces for each phase of the development shall be submitted to and approved by the local planning authority prior to the commencement of relevant works within that phase, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the local planning authority. The development shall be carried out in accordance with the approved materials.  Phase 1 shall be undertaken in accordance with the details approved by references 2014/2965, 2014/3527, 2014/6005, and 2015/5139. Phase 2 shall be undertaken in accordance with the details approved by reference 2019/4992.
In order to assess the suitability of the proposed materials, in the interests of the appearance of the locality, in accordance with Council policy DMS1
Condition : 5 - Details of arrangements for the storage of refuse shall be submitted to and approved by the local planning authority before each phase of the development begins (excluding demolition), unless otherwise agreed in writing by the local planning authority. The works shall be carried out before the permitted use starts in each phase.  Phase 1 shall be undertaken in accordance with the details approved by reference 2013/2090. Phase 2 shall be undertaken in accordance with the details approved by reference 2019/4674. 
In the interests of amenity and hygiene, in accordance with Council policy DMS1.
Condition : 6 - For each phase of the development, details of surrounding noise environment and insulation against external noise generated by roads and railway and anticipated noise generated by the commercial units and community centre (to good/reasonable standard of Table 5 of the British Standard BS8233 as identified within the "Sustainable Design and Construction SPG (2006)) shall be submitted to and approved by the local planning authority. The approved measures shall be installed prior to the commencement of the occupation of the building. Phase 1 shall be undertaken in accordance with the details approved by reference 2016/0197. Phase 2 shall be undertaken in accordance with the details approved by reference 2020/3527.
To protect the occupiers of the building(s), in accordance with Council policies DMH4(ii)
Condition : 7 - Details of noise insulation measures to provide effective resistance to the transmission of airborne and impact sound between the commercial and community uses and the residential units shall be submitted to and approved by the local planning authority. The approved measures shall be completed prior to the commencement of the use of the relevant premises. Phase 2 shall be undertaken in accordance with the details approved by reference 2020/3527.
To safeguard the amenities of adjoining occupiers, in accordance with Council policy DMS1.
Condition : 8 - For each phase of the development details of facilities for people with disabilities shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority before development (excluding demolition) commences. Such facilities as approved shall be provided prior to the occupation of each phase and maintained thereafter. Phase 1 shall be undertaken in accordance with the details approved by reference 2013/2090. Phase 2 shall be undertaken in accordance with the details approved by reference 2019/4677
To ensure that disabled people can satisfactorily use the building(s), in accordance with Council policy DMS(i)
Condition : 9 - The facilities for people with disabilities shown on the approved plans shall be provided prior to the occupation of the buildings/commencement of the uses, and maintained thereafter.  Phase 1 shall be undertaken in accordance with the details approved by reference 2013/2090. 
To ensure that disabled people can satisfactorily use the building(s), in accordance with Council policy DMS(i)

Condition : 10 - Details of any external ventilation equipment, including ducting, shall be submitted to and approved by the local planning authority before installation. The ventilation equipment shall be implemented in accordance with the approved details. Phase 2 shall be undertaken in accordance with the details approved by reference 2021/1439. 
In the interests of local amenity and visual appearance, and in accordance with Council policy DMS1

Condition : 11 - Details of landscaping, play space/equipment and treatment of parts of the site not covered by buildings, to include species of new planting and any existing plants/trees to be retained, shall be submitted to and approved by the local planning authority before the commencement of relevant works within each phase of the development. All planting, seeding or turfing, landscape works, playspace/equipment included in the approved details shall be carried out prior to the occupation of any part of the relevant phase, or in accordance with a programme agreed in writing with the local planning authority.  Phase 1 shall be undertaken in accordance with the details approved by reference 2013/2434. Phase 2 shall be undertaken in accordance with the details approved by reference 2019/4728. 
To ensure a satisfactory appearance, in accordance with Council policy DMS1
Condition : 12 - Details of the means of protecting the trees (which are to be retained) from damage during building works, including site supervision arrangements, shall be submitted to and approved by the local planning authority before the start of any demolition, building or other work for each phase of the development. Such protection shall be installed and retained as approved throughout the period of works.  Phase 1 shall be undertaken in accordance with the details approved by reference 2012/5199. Phase 2 shall be undertaken in accordance with the details approved by reference 2016/4298.
To safeguard the trees in the interest of the amenity of the area, in accordance with Council policy DMO5 (b)
Condition : 13 - Prior to planting in each phase of the development, details of trees, including size, species and location are to be approved in writing by the local planning authority.  The planting shall be carried out in accordance with those details.  Any trees which within a period of five years from the completion of the development is found to be dead, removed or becomes seriously damaged or diseased, shall be replaced in the next planting season with others of a similar size and species. Phase 1 shall be undertaken in accordance with the details approved by reference 2013/2434. Phase 2 shall be undertaken in accordance with the details approved by reference 2020/2631. 
To safeguard the trees in the interest of the amenity of the area, in accordance with Council policy DMO5 (a)
Condition : 14 - The screening/enclosure to the balconies/roof terraces, shown on the approved drawings, shall be completed before any use of the balconies/terraces commence, and retained permanently afterwards.  
To protect the privacy of neighbours and prevent overlooking in accordance with Council policy DMS1(c)
Condition : 15 - The development shall be carried out in accordance with the approved drawings
SJH3-HBA-SW-00-DR-A-08-0100, SJH3-HBA-SW-00-DR-A-08-0103, SJH3-HBA-SW-XX-DR-A-08-0101, SJH3-HBA-SW-XX-DR-A-08-0102, 1615_DWG_PL_xx_010_02,1615_DWG_PL_xx_012_04, 1615_DWG_PL_xx_013_02,1615_DWG_PL_xx_014_01, 1615_DWG_PL_xx_110_03, SJH3-HBA-ZZ-ZZ-DR-A-08-0218, SJH3-HBA-ZZ-ZZ-DR-A-08-0219, 1615_DWG_PL_xx_112_03, 1615_DWG_PL_xx_113_03, 1615_DWG_PL_xx_114_03, 1615_DWG_PL_xx_300_04, 1081_DWG_01_00_900, 1081_DWG_01_00_901, 1081_DWG_01_00_902, 1081_DWG_ 01_00_903, 1081_DWG_01_00_904, 1081_DWG_01_00_905, 1081_DWG_01_00_906, 1081_DWG_01_00_907, 1081_DWG_01_00_910, 1081_DWG_01_00_911, 1081_DWG_01_00_912, 1081_DWG_01_00_913, 1081_DWG_01_00_914, 1081_DWG_01_00_915, 1081_DWG_01_00_916, 1081_DWG_01_00_917, 1615_DWG_PL_02_000_17, 1615_DWG_PL_02_001_13, 1615_DWG_PL_02_002_15, 1615_DWG_PL_02_003_12, 1615_DWG_PL_02_004_12, 1615_DWG_PL_02_005_12, 1615_DWG_PL_02_006_12, 1615_DWG_PL_02_007_13, 1615_DWG_PL_02_008_10, 1615_DWG_PL_02_009_06, 1615_DWG_PL_02_010_05, 1615_DWG_PL_02_011_07, 1615_DWG_PL_02_100_05, 1615_DWG_PL_02_101_05, 1615_DWG_PL_02_102_05, 1615_DWG_PL_02_103_05, 1615_DWG_PL_02_200_03, 1615_DWG_PL_02_300_03,SJH3-HBA-03-00-DR-A-08-0110, SJH3-HBA-03-01-DR-A-08-0111, SJH3-HBA-03-02-DR-A-08-0112, SJH3-HBA-03-03-DR-A-08-0113, SJH3-HBA-03-04-DR-A-08-0114, SJH3-HBA-03-05-DR-A-08-0115, SJH3-HBA-03-06-DR-A-08-0116, SJH3-HBA-03-07-DR-A-08-0117, SJH3-HBA-03-08-DR-A-08-0118, SJH3-HBA-03-09-DR-A-08-0119, SJH3-HBA-03-10-DR-A-08-0120, SJH3-HBA-03-11-DR-A-08-0121, SJH3-HBA-03-XX-DR-A-08-0122, SJH3-HBA-03-XX-DR-A-08-0200, SJH3-HBA-03-XX-DR-A-08-0201, SJH3-HBA-03-XX-DR-A-08-0202, SJH3-HBA-03-XX-DR-A-08-0203, SJH3-HBA-03-XX-DR-A-08-0204, SJH3-HBA-03-XX-DR-A-08-0205, SJH3-HBA-03-XX-DR-A-08-0206, SJH3-HBA-03-XX-DR-A-08-0207, SJH3-HBA-03-XX-DR-A-08-0208, SJH3-HBA-03-XX-DR-A-08-0209,SJH3-HBA-03-ZZ-DR-A-08-0212, SJH3-HBA-03-ZZ-DR-A-08-0213, SJH3-HBA-03-ZZ-DR-A-08-0214, SJH3-HBA-03-ZZ-DR-A-08-0215, SJH3-HBA-03-ZZ-DR-A-08-021
Condition : 16 - The parking areas shown on the approved plans shall be provided before the occupation of the associated phase of the development, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the local planning authority, and shall be retained for parking purposes for the users of the development and for no other purpose. 
To ensure adequate arrangements are made for off-street parking in accordance with Council policy DMT2.
Condition : 17 - Notwithstanding the provisions of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) Order 2015, or any future enactment of that Order, no windows, doors or glazed areas (other than such as may be shown on the approved plans) shall be formed in any wall of the buildings without the prior written consent of the local planning authority.
To protect the privacy of neighbours and prevent overlooking, in accordance with Council policy DMS1
Condition : 18 - Notwithstanding the provisions of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) Order 2015, or any future re-enactment of that Order, no satellite dishes, telecommunications masts or equipment or associated structures, shall be installed on the building without the prior written approval of the local planning authority. Phase 1 shall be undertaken in accordance with the details approved by reference 2015/7203.
To protect the appearance of the building, and accord with Council policy DMS9
Condition : 19 - No water tanks, plant, lift rooms or other structures (except those shown on the approved planning application drawings) shall be erected upon the roofs of the approved buildings without the written approval of the local planning authority.
To control the appearance of the buildings and safeguard the appearance of the area, in accordance with Council policy DMS1
Condition : 20 - Anti-vibration treatment at the top of the pile caps of the buildings must be implemented on the buildings closest to the railway to reduce the impact of vibration to occupiers of those units, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the local planning authority.
To protect the occupiers of the buildings, in accordance with Council policy DMH4(ii)
Condition : 21 - The cycle storage provision shown on the approved drawings shall be provided before the occupation of each associated phase of the development and shall be retained permanently thereafter for users of the development and for no other purpose. 
To provide cycle parking in accordance with policy DMT2(ii)
Condition : 22 - Details of the sustainability/energy reduction measures and renewable energy measures shall be submitted to and approved in writing before commencement of development (excluding demolition). The approved details shall be implemented in compliance with the details approved by reference 2013/2522 and 2020/0285, policy DMS3 and thereafter maintained, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the local planning authority. 
To provide sustainable design in accordance with policy DMS3
Condition : 23 - The residential units hereby approved shall be built to a minimum standard Code for Sustainable Homes Level 4, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the local planning authority.
To provide sustainable design in accordance with policy DMS3
Condition : 24 - All residential units within Phases 1 and 2 should be built to lifetime homes standard.
To provide housing in accordance with Policy IS5.
Condition : 25 - Within 3 months of work starting on site (excluding demolition) in phases 1 and 2, a Code for Sustainable Homes Interim (Design Stage) Certificate, issued by the Building Research Establishment (BRE) (or equivalent accredited body) must be submitted to the local planning authority to show that a
minimum Level 4 rating will be achieved for the dwellings. Phase 1 shall be undertaken in accordance with the details
approved by reference 2014/1225. Phase 2 shall be undertaken in accordance with the details approved by reference 2019/5151.
To provide sustainable design in accordance with policy DMS3
Condition : 26 - Prior to first occupation of each building within Phases 1 and 2, a post-completion from an accredited body confirming compliance with policy DMS3 and that the dwellings achieve Level 4 and the Energy Performance Certificate must be submitted to the local planning authority. Following occupation of the dwellings the developer shall, within 7 days of receipt of the BRE Code for Sustainable Homes Final (PostConstruction) Certificate, issue it to the local planning authority. All the measures integrated shall be retained for as long as the development is in existence, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the local planning authority. Phase 1 shall be undertaken in accordance with the details approved by reference 2016/6818.
To provide sustainable design in accordance with policy DMS3
Condition : 27 - Within 3 months of work starting on site (excluding demolition) in phases 2 and 3, a BREEAM Interim (Design Stage) Certificate, issued by the Building Research Establishment (BRE) (or equivalent accredited body), must be submitted to the local planning authority to confirm compliance with policy DMS3 and show that an Excellent rating will be achieved for the commercial and community units. Phase 2 shall be undertaken in accordance with the details approved by reference 2019/4612.
To provide sustainable design in accordance with policy DMS3
Condition : 28 - The commercial and community units hereby approved should be built to BREEAM (Excellent), unless otherwise agreed in writing by the local planning authority.
To provide sustainable design in accordance with policy DMS3
Condition : 29 - Prior to occupation of the approved commercial and community units a copy of the Post Construction Certificate verifying the BREEAM rating of Excellent shall be submitted to the local planning authority to confirm compliance with policy DMS3.  All the measures integrated shall be retained for as long as the development is in existence, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the local planning authority.
To provide sustainable design in accordance with policy DMS3.
Condition : 30 - Schedules of the affordable housing service charge shall be provided annually for the first five years following practical completion of each phase of the development.
To ensure that the units remain affordable in accordance with policy IS5
Condition : 31 - Prior to the commencement of the relevant phase of development (excluding demolition), submit a scheme demonstrating that the headroom of the vehicular accesses into covered car parking areas are sufficient to cater for wheelchair accessible vehicles (at least 2.60m headroom) and complemented with mounted 'height restriction signage'. Phase 1 shall be undertaken in accordance with the details approved by reference 2013/1950.
To ensure adequate access to the parking in accordance with policy DMT2
Condition : 32 - For each phase of development details of the enclosed secure cycle parking spaces (total 865) shall be submitted to the local planning authority for approval. The approved details shall be implemented in accordance with the approved details. Phase 1 shall be undertaken in accordance with the details approved by reference 2013/2434. Phase 2 shall be undertaken in accordance with the details approved by reference 2020/3528.
To provide cycle parking in accordance with policy DMT2(ii) 
Condition : 33 - The surface water discharge for the approved Phase 3 shall be limited to 5.5l/s and the site wide surface water discharge shall be limited to 18.2l/s, as detailed in paragraph 6.3.3 of the FRA.
To reduce flood risk in accordance with policy DMS5
Condition : 34 - Development shall not begin (excluding demolition) until a sustainable surface water drainage scheme for the site (including provision of green roofs, sub-surface level tanks, porous paving) has been submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority. The drainage strategy should include hydraulic calculations/modelling in support of the proposed strategy, an assessment of exceedance flood flow routes, a SuDS/drainage maintenance plan and overall demonstrate the surface water run-off generated up to and including the 100yr critical storm will not exceed the run-off from the undeveloped site following the corresponding rainfall event, and so not increase the risk of flooding both on or off-site. The scheme shall subsequently be implemented in accordance with the approved details before the development is completed. Phase 1 shall be undertaken in accordance with the details approved by reference 2013/2434. Phase 2 shall be undertaken in accordance with the details approved by reference 2019/4613.
To reduce flood risk in accordance with policy DMS5
Condition : 35 - In all areas of the site where there is overlying made ground present and where gardens or soft landscaping are proposed, then a minimum of 600mm certified clean soil cover shall be provided as a replacement and/or cover of the made ground. Upon completion of all groundworks and landscaping for each phase of development, a verification report shall be submitted for the Council's approval that demonstrates that the requirements of this condition have been achieved. Phase 1 shall be undertaken in accordance with the details approved by reference 2016/0537.
To comply with policy DMS1 regarding existing contamination

Condition : 36 - An overarching Arts Strategy for the site, informed through discussions with Wandsworth Arts and Planning Services, shall be submitted to the local planning authority for approval prior to commencement of above ground works (excluding demolition). This should include how art work will be integrated into the buildings and/or landscaping of the development, relating to the site and local area. The details approved in writing shall be implemented in accordance with a programme agreed in writing with the local planning authority.  Phase 1 shall be undertaken in accordance with the details approved by references 2014/2848, 2014/6258, and 2015/5619. Phase 2 shall be undertaken in accordance with the details approved by reference 2020/2748.
In the interests of the visual amenity of the development and quality of the environment in accordance with policy DMS1
Condition : 37 - For each phase of development, works shall not take place until the developer has secured the implementation of a programme of archaeological recording, photographic recording and survey work of the standing historic building(s) and an associated report, in accordance with a written scheme of investigation which has been submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority.  Phase 1 shall be undertaken in accordance with the details approved by reference 2012/5826. Phase 2 shall be undertaken in accordance with the details approved by reference 2019/4611.
To comply with policy DMS2.
Condition : 38 - For each phase of development, works shall not take place until the applicant has secured the implementation of a programme of archaeological work in accordance with a written scheme for investigation which has been submitted by the applicant and approved by the local planning authority. The development shall only take place in accordance with the detailed scheme pursuant to this condition. The archaeological works shall be carried out by a suitably qualified investigating body acceptable to the local planning authority.  Phase 1 shall be undertaken in accordance with the details approved by reference 2012/5826. Phase 2 shall be undertaken in accordance with the details approved by reference 2019/4611.
To comply with policy DMS2.
Condition : 39 - Prior to the commencement of phase 3 of the development (excluding demolition), the applicant shall submit a Vacancy Strategy for approval by the local planning authority. The approved strategy shall be implemented in full once the commercial units have been built to shell and core unless otherwise agreed in writing by the local planning authority.  
To preserve the vitality of the town centre in accordance with policy DMTS1
Condition : 40 - Prior to first occupation of each commercial and community building, details and times of servicing and delivery to the building shall be submitted and approved by the local planning authority.  The uses shall operate in accordance with the approved details.
To comply with policy DMS1c
Condition : 41 - The development will be of part 4-12, 4-12, 10, 5-7 and 4-6 storey construction with a maximum height of 12 storeys, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.
To ensure a satisfactory standard of development, and to allow the local planning authority to review any potential changes to the scheme. 
Condition : 42 - The development will include 530 square metres of community space in the centre of the site and approximately  451 square metres of commercial space (classes A1-A5 (retail, financial and professional services, cafe/restaurant, take away, pub/bar and/or B1 office use) at the northern end of the site unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority
To ensure a satisfactory standard of development, and to allow the local planning authority to review any potential changes to the scheme. 
Condition : 43 - The development will provide 658 residential units (Use Class C3 and Older Person's Social Rented) across the site, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority
To ensure a satisfactory standard of development, and to allow the local planning authority to review any potential changes to the scheme. 
Condition : 44 - The development will include 102 car parking spaces located at within the development, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.
To ensure a satisfactory standard of development, and to allow the local planning authority to review any potential changes to the scheme. 
Condition : 45 - Prior to commencement for each building in Phase 3 details shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority demonstrating that a minimum of at least one lift per core (or more subject to capacity assessments) will be a suitably sized fire evacuation lift suitable to be used to evacuate people who require level access from the building. The development shall be carried out in accordance with these details and maintained as such in perpetuity. Reason: In the interests of fire safety in accordance with London Plan Policy D5.
Condition : 46 - Prior to the occupation of each building in Phase 3 the post-construction tab of the GLA's whole life carbon assessment template should be completed accurately and in its entirety in line with the GLA's Whole Life Carbon Assessment Guidance. The post-construction assessment should provide an update of the information submitted at planning submission stage, including the whole life carbon emission figures for all life-cycle modules based on the actual materials, products and systems used. This should be submitted to the GLA at: ZeroCarbonPlanning@london.gov.uk, along with any supporting evidence as per the guidance. Confirmation of submission to the GLA shall be submitted to, and approved in writing by, the local planning authority, prior to occupation of the relevant building. Reason: In the interests of sustainable development and to maximise on-site carbon dioxide savings in accordance with London Plan policy SI2.
Condition : 47 - Prior to the occupation of any building in Phase 3, a Post Completion Report setting out the predicted and actual performance against all numerical targets in the relevant Circular Economy Statement shall be submitted to the GLA at: CircularEconomyLPG@london.gov.uk, along with any supporting evidence as per the GLA's Circular Economy Statement Guidance. The Post Completion Report shall provide updated versions of Tables 1 and 2 of the Circular Economy Statement, the Recycling and Waste Reporting form and Bill of Materials. Confirmation of submission to the GLA shall be submitted to, and approved in writing by, the local planning authority, prior to occupation. Reason: In the interests of sustainable waste management and in order to maximise the re-use of materials in accordance with London Plan policy SI7.
Condition : 48 - Prior to demolition, an independent Pre-Demolition Audit to identify components of the building/site that can be retained or reused in line with the GLA's Circular Economy Statement Guidance must be approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. At a minimum the Pre-Demolition Audit must include:
a) An inventory of the components and materials, with an estimate of the quantities and an assessment as to the condition of the items and is suitability for reclamation;
b) Opportunities for reuse and recycling either within the proposed development or offsite;
c) A schedule of practical and realistic providers who can act as brokers for each of the reclaimed items;
d) Recommendations stating the opportunities for reclamation of items; and,
e) Target reuse and reclamation rates.
Reason: In the interests of sustainable waste management and in order to maximise the re-use of materials and demonstrate how the development will reduce waste and support the circular economy in accordance with London Plan Policy SI 7.
Condition : 49 - Prior to commencement of development, a Site Waste and Resource Management Plan shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority as per the GLA's Circular Economy Statement guidance.
 
Notification of the final destination of all waste streams (beyond the Materials Recycling Facility), as well as written confirmation that the destination landfill(s) has/have the capacity to receive waste shall be provided to the Local Planning Authority as per the GLA's Circular Economy Statement guidance.
 
Reason: In the interests of sustainable waste management and in order to maximise the re-use of materials and demonstrate how the development will reduce waste and support the circular economy in accordance with London Plan Policy SI 7.
Condition : 50 - 10% of the total site wide residential units must be provided as wheelchair accessible units. The wheelchair accessible units within Phase 3 must meet Building Regulation requirement M4(3) 'wheelchair user dwellings' (designed to be wheelchair accessible or easily adaptable for residents who are wheelchair users), and all remaining residential units within Phase 3 must meet Building Regulation requirement M4(2) 'accessible and adaptable dwellings'.
Reason: To provide housing in accordance with Policy IS5 and Policy D7 of the London Plan (2021)
Condition : 51 - INFORMATIVE: In dealing with this application the Council has implemented the requirement in the National Planning Policy Framework 2021 to work with the applicant in a positive and proactive manner and the Council has, as far as practicable, sought solutions to problems arising in relation to dealing with the planning application.  The Council has made available detailed advice in the form of its statutory policies in the Local Plan consisting of the Core Strategy, Development Management Policies Document, Supplementary Planning Documents and where appropriate the Site Specific Allocations Document as well as offering a full pre-application advice service, in order to ensure that the applicant has been given every opportunity to submit an application which is likely to be considered favourably. In addition, where appropriate, further guidance was offered to the applicant during the processing of the application.
description:
Variation of Condition 15 (in accordance with approved drawings), Condition 24 (lifetime homes standards), Condition 25 (Code for Sustainable Homes Interim (Design Stage) Certificate), Condition 28 (Energy Performance Certificate), Condition 32 (secure cycle parking spaces), Condition 41 (building heights), Condition 42 (non-residential floorspace) and Condition 43 (residential units) pursuant to planning permission dated 19/01/2019 ref 2017/5837 to allow:
Changes to internal residential layouts resulting in an amended residential unit mix (including an increase of up to 59 residential units); minor adjustments to the massing, building footprint and height of Plots 3 and 7 (Phase 3) and associated changes to the external building faade of Plots 3, 7and 8 (Phase 3); reconfiguration of commercial floorspace; alterations to play space and landscape design, servicing arrangements, cycle parking and provision of plant.
